reasoning: Choriocarcinoma is extremely rare, occurring in ~1 per 40,000 pregnancies. Global estimate ~0.05 per 100k population based on birth rates and incidence data.
source: Lurain JR. (2010). Gestational trophoblastic disease I: epidemiology, pathology, clinical presentation and diagnosis. Am J Obstet Gynecol. 203(6):531-539
